post.description:
Get price data from Birdeye API or Codex API for multiple tokens across different chain IDs.
Uses feature flag USE_CODEX_FOR_PRICES to determine which API to use.
Groups token addresses by chain ID and makes separate calls to the API.
Returns the combined results from all chains.

Request body example:
{
    "asset_ids": [
        "solana:101-So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112",
        "eip155:1-0x6982508145454ce325ddbe47a25d4ec3d2311933"
    ]
}

Get OHLCV data from Birdeye API or Codex API for a token.
Uses feature flag USE_CODEX_FOR_OHLCV to determine which API to use.

Request body example:
{
    "asset_id": "solana:101-So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112",
    "granularity": "1H",
    "time_from": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z",
    "time_to": "2024-01-02T00:00:00Z"
}

get.description: Get action details by action ID.

parameters.name: read_only

schema.description: Whether to process in read-only mode
schema.title: Read Only

parameters.description: Whether to process in read-only mode

post.description:
Get action status by providing wallet address, chain ID, and transaction hash.
Returns whether the action is stored in the database along with action details.

Get all actions involving a specific asset on a chain.

- For NFTs (category='nft'): Uses the contract_address column directly
- For tokens (category='token'): Searches in swap_info for token_address on buy/sell sides

post.summary: List Actions By User And Asset
post.description:
Get all actions for a specific user involving a specific asset on a chain.

- For NFTs (category='nft'): Uses the contract_address column directly
- For tokens (category='token'): Searches in swap_info for token_address on buy/sell sides

Get actions for related assets (NFTs or tokens) from a given action.

For NFT actions:
  - Extracts collection_asset_ids from nft_info.collection
  - Returns NFT actions for those collections (effectively nft_collection asset_type)

For token actions:
  - Based on label (token_buy/token_sell), extracts token_asset_id from the appropriate
    side of the swap (tokens_bought or tokens_sold)
  - Always takes the first token if multiple tokens exist
  - Returns token actions for those tokens

Restrictions:
  - Actions must be exclusively NFT OR token category (not both)
  - Actions with mixed categories return empty response

All results are filtered by the same user who performed the original action.
